com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSCollectionCreditCardUE


  • public interface YFSCollectionCreditCardUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct collectionCreditCard(YFSEnvironment env, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct inStruct)
      The YFSCollectionCreditCardUE user exit provides the option of plugging in custom logic for authorizing and charging credit card related payments.

    • Method Detail

      • collectionCreditCard

        YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct collectionCreditCard(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                          YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct inStruct)
                                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSCollectionCreditCardUE user exit provides the option of plugging in custom logic for authorizing and charging credit card related payments. This is invoked by the Platform payment collection agent yfs_execute_collection. You are expected to build in a payment interface to process this user exit. Otherwise, you must have payment charging information come through the order XML at order creation using the createOrder API.

        The payment collection agent picks up orders of pending credit card authorization or charging. It then calls the collectionCreditCard user exit with information about the order as an input parameter. The user exit is expected to interface with the payment system and return information about the interaction. This information is recorded on Platform for further processing while authorizing or for audit purposes while charging.

        The user exit has four options for processing a request:

        • Authorize or charge online and return details related to the interaction (default).
        • Request for retry later, which means the request remains as is and the request is resent to the payment interface through this user exit on the next run.
        • Request for asynchronous processing which means the Platform never contacts the payment system for this order. The payment interface (custom extension) is expected to update details corresponding to payment through the recordCollection API. This is typically the case when interfaces to the payment system are run in batch mode.
        • Error condition and request can not be processed. Pass holdOrderAndRaiseEvent as true in that case.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back. The user exit implementation is responsible for timing out and retunring if any calls to an external system fail.


        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called only if the payment type group attribute on the order reads CREDIT_CARD.

        Post-conditions:

        • Payment collection receives a confirmation about the way in which the payment collection has or will be carried out for the order under consideration.
        • If the returned outStruct, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct, returns any of the attributes below, payment collection will use them to set the corresponding attributes on the payment method.
          • If DisplaySvcNo is not passed, but the SvcNo attribute is passed, it defaults to the last 4 characters of SvcNo
          • If DisplayPaymentReference1 is not passed, but the PaymentReference1 attribute is passed, it defaults to the last 4 characters of PaymentReference1
          • PaymentReference1
          • PaymentReference2
          • PaymentReference3
          • SvcNo
        • However, the following errors will be thrown if the proper conditions are not met:
          • OMP11053 - Cannot update payment method when the payment type belongs to the CREDIT_CARD or CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT payment type groups.
          • OMP11054 - Cannot update payment method when it has multiple charge transaction records.
          • OMP11055 - There already exists a payment method with identical values for these attributes: OrderHeaderKey, PaymentType, CustomerAccountNo, CreditCardType, CreditCardName, CreditCardNo, CreditCardExpDate, PaymentReference1, PaymentReference2, PaymentReference3, SvcNo


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inStruct - Required. For more information see, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct.


        Returns:
        outStruct For more information see, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
